body.p: Nicholas County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah Martin Varner in Harrison County, Kentucky, on December 29, 1861. Father of Francis Varner, Armilda Varner, Elizabeth Varner, John Varner, Margaret Varner, William Varner, and Edwin Varner. Farmer in Nicholas County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Nicholas County in 1860. Fined for forfeiting a bail bond in Harrison County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 6th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a private from September 15, 1862 to January 10, 1864. Taken Prisoner of War by the United States Army in Magoffin County, Kentucky, on April 13, 1863. Signed a loyalty oath to the U. S. Government on January 10, 1864.
